item.description:
If you have joined us here before, you know how lovely these concerts are.  On the beautiful grounds at Trinity College, we meet in the Chapel front lobby area for the Chamber music portion and then move outside to the lawn to picnic and listen to the Carillon, (leave your picnic things outside on the lawn or retrieve them from your car after the Chamber music in the Chapel).

Trinity Carillon/Chamber Music

Trinity College hosts the Annual Plumb Memorial Carillon Concerts and the Annual Chamber Music Series as part of the Summer Music Series, made possible through the generous support of George Simon '69.  The music series, held annually at the College, features performances every Wednesday during the summer, over a nine-week period. The Carillon Series complements the Chamber Music series, with a carillon concert immediately following each chamber music program.  Concertgoers convene outside the Chapel on the quadrangle to listen to the music of the 49-bell carillon, one of approximately 200 such instruments in North America. Many fans of the carillon series enjoy bringing picnic suppers to these outdoor concerts.

The performances are free and open to the public and will be held rain or shine.  Attendees are encouraged to bring a picnic. 

 

 Where: Trinity College, 300 Summit Street, Hartford, Conn. 06106*

 

 

Chamber Music Series:

held in the Trinity College Chapel    

~ 6 p.m.  

Greig Shearer, flute and Margreet Francis, harpsichord

 

Carillon Music Series:

held on the Long Walk Quad abutting the Chapel  

~ 7 p.m.

Claire Halpert, Cambridge, MA *

parking available on Summit and Vernon Streets
item.how_to_find_us: meet at 5:45 in the Chapel front lobby area, will wear the Black and white scarf with piano keys
item.name: Trinity Carillon/Chamber Music
